```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(GGally)
library(lme4)
library(lmerTest)
library(car)
```

```{r}
soil <- read.csv("soil.csv")
soil <- soil %>%
  rename %>%
  mutate(soil = case_when(
    soil == "FF" ~ "Forest floor",
    soil == "MIN" ~ "Mineral soil",
    TRUE ~ soil)) %>%
  mutate(site = case_when(
    site == "P1" ~ "Plow 1",
    site == "P2" ~ "Plow 2",
    site == "S1" ~ "Pasture 1",
    site == "S2" ~ "Pasture 2",
    site == "W1" ~ "Woodlot 1",
    site == "W2" ~ "Woodlot 2",
    TRUE ~ site))

#Remove NAs
soil <- na.omit(soil)

#Factor classes
soil$stake <- as.factor(soil$stake)
soil$row <- as.factor(soil$row)
soil$site <- as.factor(soil$site)


#The data were analyzed by two-way factorial analysis of variance using land-use history (woodlot, pastured, or
#cultivated) as main effects and site and row as a covariate.

sn <- lmer(n ~ factor(site) + (1|row) + (1|stake), data=soil)
summary(sn)
  
  #c ~ factor(site) + (1|row) + (1|stake) + ff.thickness + bulk.density + soil.mass + ph.h2o + ph.cacl2 + n + om + p + nh4 + no3 + n.min + nitr + cec + ca + mg + k + soil.moisture + soil.moisture.capacity, data = soil)

```
